item.title: Should I use .netrc for git authentication
item.description: I used .netrc in several projects and I wrote something about that. I thought it is a convenient way for git until recently. Recently I have a new laptop and want to setup my git credentials. This time, I noticed .netrc might not be secure as other applications that use cURL to make requests to servers defined in your .netrc file will also now be authenticated using these credentials.

item.title: argo-workflow: secrets for git

I sought to other options and find https://github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows/issues/1428 and https://www.jeffgeerling.com/blog/2019/mounting-kubernetes-secret-single-file-inside-pod. Upon I checked the logs, I found that user and password are shown in the logs of a workflow.
